item.title: Meta’s recruiting blitz claims three OpenAI researchers
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: In the fight for top AI talent, Meta just reportedly snagged a win, poaching three OpenAI researchers despite rival Sam Altman’s public mockery of Mark Zuckerberg’s lavish hiring tactics. The latest victory in Zuckerberg’s widely-reported recruiting blitz: Lucas Beyer, Alexander Kolesnikov, and Xiaohua Zhai – who established OpenAI’s Zurich office – have joined Meta’s superintelligence […]

item.title: Indian drone startup Raphe mPhibr raises $100M as military UAV demand soars
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: The startup aims to boost its R&D and local production capabilities amid growing demand for drones in battlefields and for border surveillance.

item.title: Federal judge sides with Meta in lawsuit over training AI models on copyrighted books
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: A federal judge sided with Meta on Wednesday in a lawsuit brought against the company by 13 book authors, including Sarah Silverman, that alleged the company had illegally trained its AI models on their copyrighted works.

item.title: Brad Feld on “Give First” and the art of mentorship (at any age)
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Brad Feld has spent decades operating by a simple principle: Give without expecting anything in return.

item.title: Sam Altman comes out swinging at The New York Times
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: From the moment OpenAI CEO Sam Altman stepped onstage, it was clear this was not going to be a normal interview.

item.title: Kalshi closes $185M round as rival Polymarket reportedly seeks $200M
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Investors are pouring big bucks into these two rival prediction markets.

item.title: Air quality tests around xAI’s Memphis data center raise questions
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: A legal group is questioning why a key pollutant was omitted from air quality tests near xAI's data center.

item.title: Creative Commons debuts CC signals, a framework for an open AI ecosystem
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: CC signals will allow dataset holders to detail how their content can or cannot be reused by machines, as in the case of training AI models.

item.title: Meta is adding AI-powered summaries to WhatsApp
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: The optional new feature uses Meta AI to summarize unread messages in a chat. This summary would only be visible to you, not others in your chat, the company notes.

item.title: Rubrik acquires Predibase to accelerate adoption of AI agents
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Predibase helps companies train and fine-tune open source AI models, which will help Rubrik customers deploy AI agents faster.

item.title: Getty drops key copyright claims against Stability AI, but UK lawsuit continues
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Getty Images dropped its primary claims of copyright infringement against Stability AI on Wednesday at London’s High Court, narrowing one of the most closely watched legal fights over how AI companies use copyrighted content to train their models.

item.title: Intel hits the brakes on its automotive business, and layoffs have started
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Intel has decided to close down its automotive business, a decision that will lead to layoffs.

item.title: Bernie Sanders says that if AI makes us so productive, we should get a 4-day workweek
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: As AI companies rave about how their products are revolutionizing productivity, Senator Bernie Sanders wants the tech industry to put its money where its automated mouth is.

item.title: Introducing the Going Public Stage at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: For the first time ever, TechCrunch Disrupt is launching the Going Public Stage — a brand-new destination for founders navigating the mid and late stages of company building.

item.title: Better Auth, an authentication tool by a self-taught Ethiopian dev, raises $5M from Peak XV, YC
item.dc:creator: Tage Kene-Okafor
item.description: Better Auth’s open source framework can simplify how developers manage user authentication. It’s caught the attention of some big name investors, recently raising about $5M in seed funding from Peak XV.

item.title: Sitch’s new dating app fuses human matchmaking and AI
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Sitch aims to take a more thoughtful approach to dating apps with its onboarding process and uses LLMs to bring a human matchmaker’s expertise to the dating app experience, helping people find potential matches without swiping.

item.title: Apple Sports app adds live tennis scores and a redesigned home screen
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Users will now be able to access live tennis scores and can track every point across all men’s and women’s singles matches. The revamped home screen makes it easier for fans to follow their favorite teams and leagues.

item.title: Bill Gates-backed Airloom begins building its first power plant
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Airloom takes that classic turbine concept and deconstructs it. To prove that it can generate as much power as conventional wind turbines, Airloom broke ground on its pilot site northwest of Laramie, Wyoming, on Wednesday.

item.title: Winning capital for your AI startup? Kleida Martiro is leading the conversation at TechCrunch All Stage
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: AI-native startups are rewriting the rules of what early traction looks like — and too often, investors are still playing by the old ones. At TechCrunch All Stage, happening in Boston on July 15, Kleida Martiro, partner at Glasswing Ventures, will lead a breakout that cuts straight to the core of this disconnect.

item.title: Bumble to lay off 30% of its workforce
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Dating app Bumble announced on Wednesday that it's laying off 30% of its workforce, impacting around 240 positions.
